channel.title: Hosting Help
channel.description:
So recently I found a 667 source and client on google and I decided to take it, as I wanted to code it and make it different.
I changed the IP's to localhost (127.0.0.1) and I was able to log-in, but when I tried to change the IP's to my no-ip, it gets stuck at Checking for Updates - 1%. I've tried portforwarding though I'm not 100% sure if it worked, but if anyone could help me with portforwarding Belkin could you please help me?
Thanks.

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @Dharma Dharma
item.description:
@Dharma wrote:

Do you already have the cache? It might be stuck at downloading it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @NieX NieX
item.description:
@NieX wrote:

You’re going to have to play off your local host and Jar it with your no-ip, this will be what you send to the public.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Help
item.dc:creator: @TeeBark TeeBark
item.description:
@TeeBark wrote:

So recently I found a 667 source and client on google and I decided to take it, as I wanted to code it and make it different.

I’ve tried portforwarding though I’m not 100% sure if it worked, but if anyone could help me with portforwarding Belkin could you please help me?

Thanks.
